content.p: There are currently no release quality builds of JFreeCiv.
These builds are generated every night from the latest source in cvs. Use them at your own risk!
Note: the binary distribution is not in a playable state. See below for how to run JFreeCiv.
The easiest way to compile the source is to use Ant. You should build the default target.

The data files consist of all the images and rules for Freeciv. JFreeCiv uses the standard set of data files that ship with the C version of FreeCiv. If you don't already have the Freeciv 1.12.0 data files on your system, you can download them
here (914k).

ol.li: Download a binary distribution or build a source distribution using the instructions above.
Download the data files if you don't have them (see above)
Ensure java.exe from Java 1.3 or Java 1.4 is in your PATH.
Bring up a command prompt or shell, and change to the directory you decompressed the downloaded archives into.

If you built from source, run JFreeCiv using: java -Dfreeciv.datadir=/path/to/datadir -classpath jfreeciv-src/class org.freeciv.client.Client If you downloaded a binary, run JFreeCiv using: java -Dfreeciv.datadir=/path/to/datadir -classpath jfreeciv/lib/jfreeciv-1.0.jar org.freeciv.client.Client Replace /path/to/datadir with the location of your data files.
